abstract: News Analysis; emails totaling 3,000 pages, released by State Department from first year in tenure of former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton, offer window into her professional life at time; messages reveal how she navigated early days of working for Pres Obama shortly after competing with him for 2008 Democratic presidential nomination.
lead_paragraph: The nearly 3,000 pages of emails released from Hillary Rodham Clinton’s first year as secretary of state reveal the early awkwardness of working for the man who had beaten her for the presidency.

headline.main: Emails Show Hillary Clinton Trying to Find Her Place
headline.print_headline: Emails Show Clinton Trying to Find Her Place

snippet: The nearly 3,000 pages of emails released from Hillary Rodham Clinton’s first year as secretary of state reveal the early awkwardness of working for the man who had beaten her for the presidency.
